title: 3 Simple Ways to Tell if Someone Has Snapchat Plus

steps.title: Snapchat+ users have a badge that appears on their profile.
steps.content: Snapchat+ users have a badge that appears on their profile. This badge looks like a white star with a black background. Navigate to a friend's profile and look for a badge next to their display name. [1] X Research source Keep in mind that this badge is hidden by default and can only be enabled by the Snapchat+ user in their Snapchat+ membership settings.

steps.title: Snapchat+ users can keep their Stories up for one week.
steps.content: Snapchat+ users can keep their Stories up for one week. With normal users, Snap Stories disappear after 24 hours of posting. However, Snapchat+ users can set Stories to be up from one hour to one week. [2] X Research source If you notice a friend's Story has been up longer than 24 hours, they are most likely a Snapchat+ user .

steps.title: A "Post View Emoji" is a Snapchat+ feature.
steps.content: A "Post View Emoji" is a Snapchat+ feature. When Snapchat+ users enable this feature , an emoji of their choice will appear next to their name once they've viewed your Snap. [3] X Research source If you notice this emoji next to a friend's name in your Chat tab, they are most likely a Snapchat+ user.
